description: Different hard bound nonfiction history books.  That's the base item.

name.str_pl: copies of Rome: Rise, Conquest and Collapse

variants.description: This history book tells in a methodical and detailed way the rise and fall of Ancient Rome, from the mythological tale of Romulus and Remus, to the conquests of Alexander the Great, to the decline and complete fall of the Roman Empire.  It explores the military campaigns, cultural achievements, and political intrigues that shaped Ancient Rome.

name.str: The American Revolution: Forging a New Nation
name.str_pl: copies of The American Revolution: Forging a New Nation

variants.description: A history book about the crucible of revolution that witness the birth of a nation.  It follows the American Founding Fathers, from the Boston Tea Party to the signing of the Declaration of Independence, as they chart a course toward liberty and self-governance.

name.str: The French Revolution: Liberty, Equality, Fraternity
name.str_pl: copies of The French Revolution: Liberty, Equality, Fraternity

variants.description: Telling the tumultuous upheaval of revolutionary France, where the ideals of liberty and equality clashed with the forces of monarchy and aristocracy, this history book explores the Reign of Terror, the Rise of Napoleon, and the Legacy of the French Revolution.

name.str: The American Civil War: Divided Nation, United Resolve
name.str_pl: copies of The American Civil War: Divided Nation, United Resolve

variants.description: This fascinating and complete history book transports its reader to the bloody battlefields and political upheaval of America's Civil War.  It explore and explain the causes, key battles, and lasting consequences of this epic struggle for the soul of a now defunct nation.

name.str: The Age of Exploration: Voyages of Discovery
name.str_pl: copies of The Age of Exploration: Voyages of Discovery

variants.description: This history book contains uncharted seas of knowledge with history's greatest explorers.  From Columbus's Journey to the New World to Magellan's circumnavigation of the globe, it trace the daring expeditions that expanded the horizons of humanity back in the day.

name.str: The Industrial Revolution: A World Transformed
name.str_pl: copies of The Industrial Revolution: A World Transformed

variants.description: This hard-cover history book explore and explain the dawn of the Industrial and Modern Age as steam engines, factories, and new technologies revolutionize society, as well as the economic, social, and environmental impacts of this transformative era on both sides of the Atlantic

name.str: The Space Race: Reaching for the Stars
name.str_pl: copies of The Space Race: Reaching for the Stars

variants.description: This history book revives the rivalry between superpowers as they race to conquer the final frontier.  From Sputnik to the Apollo moon landings, it follows the triumphs and tragedies of humanity's quest to explore the cosmos during the tensions of the Cold War.

name.str: The Fall of the Berlin Wall: End of an Era
name.str_pl: copies of The Fall of the Berlin Wall: End of an Era

variants.description: This history book tells and explains the collapse of communism and the reunification of Germany in the wake of the Cold War.  It explore the events leading up to the fall of the Berlin Wall and the subsequent reshaping of global geopolitics.

name.str: The Civil Rights Movement: Struggle for Equality
name.str_pl: copies of The Civil Rights Movement: Struggle for Equality

variants.description: This plain, hard-cover history book puts the reader on the front lines of America's fight for civil rights, from the Montgomery Bus Boycott to the March on Washington.  It has interesting articles on the lives and works of courageous activists and ordinary citizens who challenged segregation and bigotry to demand justice and equality.

name.str: The Arab Spring: Revolution in the Digital Age
name.str_pl: copies of The Arab Spring: Revolution in the Digital Age

variants.description: This book on modern history explores and explains the wave of pro-democracy protests that swept across the Middle East and North Africa in 2011.  It delves the reader into the social media-fueled uprisings, government crackdowns, and struggles for political reform and human rights.  Eh, if only they knew that the Cataclysm was about to happen.
